remarks: If ` A ` is a line containing two distinct points ` P ` and ` Q ` , then ` A ` is the line through ` P ` and ` Q ` .  Theorem 6.18 of [Schwabhauser] p. 45.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 25-May-2019.)
statement:
tglineelsb2.p $e |- B = ( Base ` G ) $.
tglineelsb2.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
tglineelsb2.l $e |- L = ( LineG ` G ) $.
tglineelsb2.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
tglineelsb2.1 $e |- ( ph -> P e. B ) $.
tglineelsb2.2 $e |- ( ph -> Q e. B ) $.
tglineelsb2.4 $e |- ( ph -> P =/= Q ) $.
tglinethru.0 $e |- ( ph -> P =/= Q ) $.
tglinethru.1 $e |- ( ph -> A e. ran L ) $.
tglinethru.2 $e |- ( ph -> P e. A ) $.
tglinethru.3 $e |- ( ph -> Q e. A ) $.
tglinethru $p |- ( ph -> A = ( P L Q ) ) $.
